pr_title: CLDR-11771 Add unit test for VettingViewer.getMissingStatus

timeline.message:
CLDR-11771 Add unit test for VettingViewer.getMissingStatus

-New method TestUtilities.TestMissingStatus

-Delete some dead code

-Comments

timeline.bodyText: How could we test for MissingStatus.DISPUTED? It would require the kind of CLDRFile that reflects voting in progress; do we have a way to set that up in the context of cldr-unittest TestAll?
timeline.author: btangmu

replies.bodyText: We'd have to set it up so that the callback returned the interesting information, I'm guessing.
replies.author: macchiati

replies.bodyText:
One way would be to leverage the TestSTFactory which already sets up vetters, disputes, etc. It actually creates a STFactory though which has a DB backing.
But all you need is a UsersChoice<Organization> subclass - VettingViewer.main() constructs one which includes disputed values, which looks quite suitable for a test case.
replies.author: srl295

replies.bodyText: actually, getMissingStatus() will never return disputed, but member function getErrorOnPath() will.
replies.author: srl295

replies.bodyText:
actually, getMissingStatus() will never return disputed, but member function getErrorOnPath() will.

Good point! The ancient bug, for which this is a follow-up, was https://unicode-org.atlassian.net/browse/CLDR-11765 and it involved items under Disputed in the Dashboard, hence my confusion...
I think this is the first unit test for any method in VettingViewer. Obviously more tests would be helpful.
I doubt whether getMissingStatus even belongs in VettingViewer -- shouldn't the status be the same regardless of whether an item is viewed in the Dashboard or the DataSection view?
replies.author: btangmu

replies.bodyText: @btangmu it seems to be more of a utility function that may belong somewhere else.
replies.author: srl295
